The goal is to fine-tune LLMs to generate customized graphics based on textual descriptions, tailored to specific organizational needs. The project utilizes Python and requires skills in machine learning, deep learning, Generative AI, and GANs. The expected outcome is a utility that can automatically generate graphic content, improving efficiency and reducing the burden on graphic designers.
summaries.Examining Adaptation Shifting in Graph D: This project investigates adaptation shifting in Graph Domain Adaptation (GDA) using adaptation-based methods. It aims to characterize domain shifts in graph data, evaluate existing GDA methods, and develop metrics/visualizations for measuring these shifts. The project involves literature review, dataset selection, implementation of state-of-the-art methods, and potentially novel algorithm development. Expected outcomes include a comprehensive analysis of adaptation shifts, new metrics for domain shift measurement, experimental insights on shift effects, and guidelines for selecting appropriate GDA methods.
summaries.Exploring Meta-Learning Strategies for F: This project explores meta-learning strategies for few-shot graph learning using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs). It aims to improve generalization in GNNs with limited labeled data by transferring knowledge across different graph learning tasks. The research involves a literature review, framework analysis, implementation of baseline methods, and the development of novel meta-learning algorithms tailored for graph-structured data. Expected outcomes include a comprehensive analysis of meta-learning approaches, novel algorithms, visualization tools for meta-knowledge transfer, and guidelines for applying meta-learning to real-world graph problems.
summaries.​Generating synthetic data​ (Sparebank1: This project explores generating synthetic banking data to enable broader data sharing and analysis while preserving privacy. The research will investigate methods like GANs and statistical distributions to synthesize transactional or aggregated datasets. The goal is to create synthetic data that retains statistical relationships present in the original data without revealing personal information. The project will use de-identified data within a secure virtual machine environment. Expected outcomes include a synthesized dataset suitable for statistical inference and exploration of different synthesis approaches.
summaries.Generative AI for Customer Relationship: This project explores the application of Generative AI, specifically Large Language Models (LLMs), to improve customer relationship management for Sparebank 1 SMN. The research aims to compare the performance of LLMs against traditional machine learning models in categorizing customer messages (emails and chats in Norwegian). The project will utilize a dataset of over 560,000 messages provided by Sparebank 1 SMN. The expected outcome is to determine if LLMs can offer more reliable message categorization, potentially enhancing customer service and providing a competitive advantage.
summaries.RECONSTRUCTION OF NIDAROSDOMEN BASED ON: This project aims to reconstruct a 3D Gaussian representation of the interior of Nidaros Cathedral from a large photographic dataset. Using Gaussian Splatting techniques, the project will generate novel views and walkthroughs of the cathedral. The project requires proficiency in Python and C/C++, and knowledge from courses like Visual Computing Fundamentals or Graphics & Visualization.
summaries.Probabilistic models for Generative AI: This project explores probabilistic models for generative AI, focusing on diffusion models and related approaches like Bayesian flow networks. The project can be tailored to the student's interests, encompassing theoretical analysis, comparative studies (e.g., diffusion models vs. GANs/VAEs), or practical applications on a dataset of interest. The expected outcome is a deeper understanding of generative AI models and their potential through either theoretical advancements, empirical comparisons, or practical implementations.
summaries.MIC - Segmentation of anatomic structure: This project explores 3D medical image segmentation using neural networks via MONAI Auto3Dseg. The research aims to develop generic segmentation tools applicable to diverse datasets, achieving state-of-the-art results in clinical tasks like aorta, brain, and prostate segmentation from CT and MRI images. Expected outcomes include a robust, adaptable segmentation pipeline and performance benchmarks across different anatomical structures.
summaries.Predicting Social Media Personalities, V: This project explores the relationship between social media activity and user personality, values, and ethics. It will investigate the application of models like Schwartz's values theory and Goldberg's Big 5 personality traits to social media text and networks. The goal is to understand how user personalities are reflected in their online behavior and social connections.
summaries.NeRFs - Neural Rendering and photorealis: This project explores Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs) for photorealistic 3D scene reconstruction, relevant to autonomous driving and simulators. It involves understanding and experimenting with NeRF variants like Instant-NeRF and Block-NeRF, alongside tools like NeRF Studio and SDF Studio. The expected outcome is a deeper understanding of NeRF technology and its application in VR/XR and simulation environments.
summaries.Prediksjon av råvarepriser: This project explores the application of machine learning and AI techniques for predicting commodity prices. The research focuses on markets experiencing or expected to experience exponential growth. The expected outcome is a model capable of forecasting commodity price fluctuations, potentially aiding investment and risk management decisions.
summaries.Pedagogical chat bot: This project focuses on developing a domain-specific chatbot using deep learning to enhance a Hyper Interactive Intelligent Presenter. The chatbot will be trained on course-related topics to assist users in acquiring basic knowledge and querying relevant materials. The project involves training the bot on diverse topics within a specific domain and evaluating its performance against various user queries. The expected outcome is a functional chatbot capable of providing informative and relevant responses to user inquiries.
summaries.Non-destructive reconstruction of 3D obj: This project explores improved methods for 3D reconstruction of CT-scanned objects using machine learning, focusing on implicit neural representations. Building upon existing research, the project aims to surpass current reconstruction quality both visually and quantitatively. The research direction will be tailored based on team interests and initial results, potentially accommodating students with strengths in physics/engineering or AI/machine learning. Expected outcomes include advanced 3D models and insights into applying machine learning to CT imaging.
summaries.Monitoring Norwegian nature loss with sa: This project aims to improve nature loss mapping in Norway using satellite imagery and AI. It will develop a local machine learning model, trained on Norwegian reference data, to directly detect and map changes in land cover. The project will explore models like 3D CNNs, RNNs, and Transformers to leverage the spatial, spectral, and temporal dimensions of satellite data. Using a dataset of 10,000+ polygons of nature loss, the student will focus on testing different model architectures. The expected outcome is a more accurate nature loss map, contributing to environmental conservation.
summaries.Sentiment and/or Figurative Language Ana: This project focuses on sentiment analysis in social media texts, specifically addressing the challenges posed by negation and figurative language (sarcasm, irony, metaphor). The primary goal is to automatically classify the sentiment (positive or negative) expressed in tweets containing figurative language, determining the degree of sentiment communicated. The project involves identifying a dataset of tweets rich in figurative language and developing methods to accurately assess sentiment despite indirect meanings.
summaries.Problems in bioinformatics: This bioinformatics project focuses on developing computational models to predict the impact of gene regulation changes on development and disease. It involves creating custom algorithms, statistical simulations, and machine learning solutions for biological data analysis. Potential projects include using genetic programming (GP) to predict microRNA target sites, support vector machines (SVM) to identify microRNA genes, or combining GP and SVMs to identify related proteins. The expected outcome is improved understanding and prediction of gene regulation's role in biological processes.
summaries.Pseudo labelling of medical data: This project addresses the lack of annotations in chest X-ray datasets like ISU by using transfer learning to generate pseudo-labels. The approach involves training deep learning models on datasets with existing annotations (e.g., VinDR) for similar abnormalities. The trained model will then be used to predict and generate pseudo-labels for the ISU dataset, enabling further research and analysis on the dataset.
summaries.Personalized Health: This project explores personalized health through recommender systems, aiming to tailor medical interventions to individual patients. Focusing on areas like nutrition, exercise, medication, or therapy, the project involves implementing a recommender system to optimize treatment strategies. The project requires skills in AI, machine learning, recommender systems, and programming for data processing, algorithm implementation, and demonstrator development. Expected outcomes include a functional recommender system and a demonstration of its ability to personalize interventions.
summaries.On-device personalization of large langu: This project explores on-device personalization of large language models (LLMs) for edge systems, aiming to reduce model complexity and latency while potentially improving accuracy. The research focuses on developing a low-overhead, hardware-aware personalization method that operates entirely on edge devices, leveraging their limited computational resources. The expected outcome is an efficient on-device personalization technique suitable for resource-constrained edge environments.
summaries.Memetic and Multimethod Stochastic Optim: This project explores memetic and multi-method stochastic optimization algorithms, integrating stochastic local search (SLS) and evolutionary algorithms (EAs) for solving computationally hard problems. The research will focus on addressing limitations in current stochastic optimization, particularly for multimodal functions, by combining SLS, EA, clustering, and feedback control. The goal is to empirically test a multi-method algorithm on synthetic and natural combinatorial optimization problems, including machine learning tasks like feature selection, and to establish performance relative to existing methods.
summaries.Multimodal Personality Prediction: This project explores multimodal personality prediction using machine learning. It aims to develop algorithms, specifically multimodal deep neural networks (DNNs), to analyze asynchronous video interviews (AVI) and online profiles (e.g., LinkedIn) to predict personality traits based on the Big Five model. The expected outcome is a system that can predict personality from multimodal data, potentially improving recruitment processes by offering an alternative to traditional questionnaires.
summaries.Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) for real t: This project explores real-time 3D reconstruction using Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF), focusing on the recent advancements by NVIDIA that significantly reduce training time. The research aims to investigate the feasibility of applying NeRF to real-time simultaneous localization and mapping (SLAM) problems, enabling the generation of 3D environments from real-time video feeds. The project will leverage techniques in neural networks, ray tracing, and potentially CUDA for optimized performance. The expected outcome is an evaluation of NeRF's applicability in real-time 3D reconstruction scenarios.
summaries.MIC - Medical Image Computing / Analysis: This project focuses on medical image computing (MIC) using deep learning (DL) and computer vision (CV) techniques applied to various organs (heart, liver, lungs, brain, prostate, etc.) and modalities (CT, MR, Ultrasound, digital pathology). The project aims to develop models, potentially using Vision Transformers (ViT), for tasks like heart/coronary artery analysis, leveraging MONAI and MONAI Label. It also explores MIC challenges from conferences like MICCAI and CVPR. Expected outcomes include novel MIC models and solutions applicable across diverse organs and imaging modalities.
summaries.RAY TRACING DATA STRUCTURES (with ARM Tr: This project focuses on implementing and evaluating ray tracing acceleration structures, specifically Bounding Volume Hierarchies (BVHs), for real-time graphics applications on ARM hardware. The student will implement a standard BVH construction algorithm (SAH or LBVH) on the CPU, with potential for a Vulkan Compute implementation. Performance will be evaluated based on build time, memory footprint, and impact on framerate. The project aims to establish a foundation for further research in improving BVH construction algorithms for the master's thesis.
summaries.Rare Anomaly Detection in Time Series (w: This project focuses on developing anomaly detection models for voltage transformer time series data from Statnett, aiming to improve maintenance prediction. The research will explore methods to identify rare anomalies indicative of maintenance needs by analyzing deviations between the three phases of voltage data. The project will address challenges posed by unlabelled data, varying data quality, and dynamic system externalities. The expected outcome is an improved anomaly detection algorithm that can predict drift early and estimate the time until a threshold is reached, enabling proactive maintenance.
summaries.Training video generation with sensor an: This project explores generating personalized training videos using sensor data and Generative AI. It aims to create "avatar" videos from sensor data and train a generative AI model to produce tailored training videos based on these avatars. The research focuses on utilizing sensor data to create avatar videos and training a generative AI model to generate training videos from avatar inputs. Expected outcomes include a methodology for personalized video generation and a trained AI model.
summaries.Software-enabled operational efficiencie: This project explores using large language models and generative AI to improve customer support and troubleshooting within Kantega SSO AS, a rapidly growing software company specializing in security solutions on the Atlassian platform. The research will leverage Kantega SSO's data and domain expertise to develop practical solutions, aiming to create software-enabled operational efficiencies. The expected outcome is improved customer support and streamlined troubleshooting processes.
summaries.VIRTUAL DEVICES ACROSS OPERATING SYSTEMS: This project explores the creation of virtual camera and microphone devices compatible across Linux, macOS, and Android operating systems. Utilizing Python and C/C++, the research aims to develop applications for real-time voice and facial characteristic modifications. The expected outcome is a functional virtual device implementation and demonstration of its capabilities through novel applications.
summaries.Simulating Language and Communication Ev: This project explores language and communication evolution using computational methods like evolutionary algorithms and reinforcement learning. It aims to simulate language evolution, potentially through "language games," to understand its dynamics. A key focus is addressing the limitations of current simulations, particularly their small and fixed population sizes. The expected outcome is a better understanding of language evolution through more realistic and scalable simulations.
summaries.Visual Creativity / Generative Visual AI: This project explores cutting-edge multi-modal foundation models for generative visual AI, focusing on text-to-image, video, and 3D content creation. It investigates architectures like DALL-E 3, Stable Diffusion, Sora, and Gen 3D. The research aims to understand these technologies and their potential applications, possibly incorporating AI-generated sound and music. Specific project focus and application areas will be defined collaboratively with the student.
summaries.Vision Transformers (for Visual Intellig: This project explores Vision Transformers (ViTs) for computer vision, focusing on both theoretical understanding and practical application. The research involves investigating the latest advancements in ViTs and applying them to domains like autonomous vehicles/robots and medical image analysis. The expected outcome is a deep understanding of ViTs and their potential to improve performance in various computer vision tasks.
summaries.Short-term planning for inspection drone: This project explores autonomous drone navigation for industrial tank inspection using reinforcement learning. It focuses on short-term path planning between predefined waypoints within a 3D model of the tank. The research aims to develop a hybrid approach, combining deep reinforcement learning and model-based predictive control (MPC), to generate collision-free and efficient paths. The resulting planning module will be evaluated through simulations using a receding horizon predictive control scheme.
summaries.Stochastic Local Search: Algorithms and: This project explores the theory and application of Stochastic Local Search (SLS) algorithms for solving computationally hard problems in AI and ML. It investigates improving SLS by combining heuristics and adaptive methods, potentially drawing from bio-inspired AI. The project also aims to reduce the computational cost of SLS in ML tasks like feature selection, possibly through Markov chain analysis and high-performance computing. Finally, it considers bridging the gap between theoretical studies of parametric Markov chains and practical applications in AI and ML, particularly in the context of trustworthy AI.
summaries.Sparse Neural Attention: This project explores a novel neural network architecture for self-attention to address the quadratic computational cost of Transformer models. The research focuses on developing a sparse attention mechanism with lower computational complexity and enhanced transformation capabilities. The model's performance will be evaluated across diverse datasets. The expected outcome is a more efficient and scalable attention model suitable for various applications.
summaries.Sports Video Analytics: This project focuses on sports video analytics, specifically predicting shot power, stroke type, and bat angle in baseball/cricket videos. It leverages a pre-existing labeled database and aims to enhance it using computer vision techniques and deep learning algorithms, particularly Vision Transformers. The expected outcome is a model capable of accurately estimating these parameters from video clips.
summaries.Topological Methods for Condition Monito: This project explores Topological Data Analysis (TDA) for condition monitoring in heavy industries, aiming to improve failure prediction in assets like wind turbines and oil & gas equipment. The research will apply persistent homology and related topological methods to industrial datasets provided by Cognite, potentially developing new topology-based methods. Expected outcomes include novel data pipelines for failure prediction, comparative analysis against deep learning, and early identification of equipment failures using TDA. Python programming skills are required.
summaries.Virtual, Augmented and Mixed Reality for: This project explores the application of Virtual, Augmented, and Mixed Reality (XR) technologies to enhance learning and training experiences, specifically in the fields of Artificial Intelligence (AI), Machine Learning (ML), and Deep Learning (DL). It also considers medical training simulations. The expected outcome is to demonstrate the potential of XR to improve knowledge acquisition and skill development in these complex domains.
summaries.Using causal information to improve gene: This project explores enhancing Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) by incorporating causal relationships to improve generative processes. The research focuses on leveraging external knowledge representations to guide code manipulation within VAEs. By encoding data into a disentangled latent space, the project aims to control specific attributes (e.g., gender, hair length) during generation. The goal is to improve the quality and coherence of generated data by considering dependencies between latent variables, evaluating the trade-off between generation quality and the amount of side information required.
summaries.Solving Cryptic Crosswords with Large La: This project explores the use of Large Language Models (LLMs) for solving cryptic crosswords, a challenging reasoning task where current LLMs achieve significantly lower accuracy than humans. The project aims to refine existing methods by benchmarking NorwAI's LLMs against state-of-the-art models. A secondary goal involves creating datasets for Norwegian cryptic crosswords, potentially through synthetic generation and collaboration with rights holders.
summaries.Uncertainty-aware Deep Learning a.k.a. D: This project explores uncertainty-aware deep learning, merging deep learning with probabilistic reasoning. It involves theoretical work and implementation using tools like TensorFlow Probability or Pyro (PyTorch). The research will address fundamental issues in deep learning, potentially drawing inspiration from resources like "The Deep Learning Book" and "ProbAI summer school." Expected outcomes include novel implementations and evaluations within a deep learning framework, requiring a strong foundation in linear algebra, statistics, machine learning, and proficiency in either TensorFlow or PyTorch.
summaries.Social Robotics: HCI in Norwegian: This project explores Human-Robot Interaction (HRI) by developing social robot functionalities with Norwegian language capabilities. Utilizing robots equipped with audio-visual sensors and a modular backend, the research focuses on enabling robots to communicate in both Norwegian and English. The expected outcome is the implementation and evaluation of new HRI functions, potentially showcased at public events, requiring strong programming skills and an interest in natural language processing.
summaries.TrønderEnergi: Explainable time-series f: This project explores explainable time-series forecasting for TrønderEnergi, focusing on making machine learning-based energy forecasts understandable for domain experts without ML expertise. The research will involve literature review, prototype development, and evaluation using real-world datasets like consumption, grid loss, weather, and power production data. The key challenge is to provide explanations that enable domain experts to understand and trust the forecasts, facilitating better decision-making in the operating center.
summaries.Uncertainty Quantification in Detection: This project explores uncertainty quantification in deep learning classifiers for detection and classification, focusing on scenarios where incorrect predictions have severe consequences. The research will involve reviewing and implementing methods for uncertainty-aware classifiers, testing their performance on out-of-distribution and manipulated images using datasets like DNV's boat image dataset, CIFAR-10, and CIFAR-100. The project aims to identify the types and extent of image manipulation that confuse classifiers and to distinguish between epistemic and aleatoric uncertainty. The expected outcome is a better understanding of how to develop AI models that can effectively express and handle uncertainty, particularly in high-risk applications.
summaries.Vision Mamba for Advanced Medical Image: This project explores Vision Mamba (ViM) for medical image analysis, investigating its advantages over CNNs and Transformers. The research involves understanding ViM's theoretical foundations and implementing existing ViM architectures on medical image datasets. The project benchmarks ViM performance against CNNs and Transformers and may involve developing novel ViM architectures for improved performance. The balance between theoretical and practical aspects will be tailored to the student's interests, incorporating the latest advancements in the rapidly evolving field of Vision Mamba in medicine.
summaries.Uncertainty Quantification for Language: This project investigates Uncertainty Quantification (UQ) for Language Models (LMs) in safety-critical systems. It addresses the need for reliable LMs by quantifying uncertainties from data limitations and model architecture. The project involves literature review, implementation, and testing of LMs (deep learning, Tsetlin machines) and UQ methods on NLP benchmark datasets. Expected outcomes include insights into UQ techniques, critical reflection on addressing LM challenges (hallucination, misinformation), and advancing UQ understanding in LMs. The project is in collaboration with DNV, a risk management company.
summaries.Mestringslæring i Intro programmering: This project investigates mastery learning in introductory programming using a mixed-methods approach. It will study a teaching intervention employing mastery learning principles. The research aims to understand the impact of this approach on student learning outcomes in introductory programming.
summaries.Designing user interfaces for drone swar: This project explores user interface design for drone swarm interaction, focusing on both onsite and remote operation. It involves researching existing drone swarm control methods, conducting user research to understand operator needs, and developing innovative interaction models. The project aims to create and prototype new interfaces for more efficient and intuitive swarm control. User testing will be conducted to refine the prototypes.
summaries.VISUALIZATION LIBRARIES IN PYTHON: This project compares five Python visualization libraries. It requires Python knowledge and familiarity with visual computing or graphics visualization concepts. The project will define a specific task to evaluate and contrast the libraries' performance and capabilities. The expected outcome is a comparative analysis of the libraries, highlighting their strengths and weaknesses for the chosen task.
summaries.XAI og bakdører i maskinlæringsmodeller: This project explores backdoors in machine learning models, replicating and extending existing research on planting backdoors, potentially using techniques from Explainable AI (XAI) to detect them. The research will investigate alternative methods for embedding backdoors. The project requires strong programming skills, an interest in mathematics and cryptography, and collaboration with students from the Department of Mathematical Sciences. Expected outcomes include understanding relevant techniques, assessing backdoor detectability, and exploring novel backdoor embedding methods.
summaries.Effects of fully immersive VR games for: This project investigates the effects of fully immersive VR games on individuals with intellectual disabilities. Focusing on their learning through repetition, the research explores VR's potential in teaching various tasks. The study aims to provide insights into the effects and usage of VR for this specific group, addressing the challenges posed by their diverse functioning levels. The expected outcome is a better understanding of how VR can support learning and development in individuals with intellectual disabilities.
summaries.Designing eco-feedback interfaces for sh: This project explores the design of eco-feedback interfaces for ships to reduce carbon emissions, as part of the OpenZero project. It involves investigating existing eco-feedback mechanisms and behavioral science principles, designing and prototyping innovative concepts tailored for maritime operations, and engaging with stakeholders for testing and refinement. The expected outcome is practical, effective, and user-friendly eco-feedback systems that encourage sustainable behaviors among ship operators, contributing to a greener maritime industry.
summaries.Designing user interfaces for sail propu: This project focuses on designing user interfaces for large, sail-equipped vessels to improve their operability and efficiency. It involves researching existing sail interfaces and current interfaces for large vessels, conducting user research to understand operator needs, and designing and prototyping user interface solutions. The designs will be validated and improved based on user feedback, with support from the OpenZero project partners. The expected outcome is a set of user interface designs that contribute to the sustainable evolution of maritime transportation.
summaries.Designing design systems for remote oper: This project focuses on designing a design system for remote operations within the OpenRemote project, specifically for unmanned surface vessels, underwater vessels, aerial drones, or port cranes. The research involves literature review, analysis of existing UI designs, and a human-centered design approach to prototype and evaluate UI elements for the chosen domain. Expected outcomes include a functional design system with documented UI elements, visual guidelines, and design principles, validated through user evaluation, to improve design consistency and reduce development effort in remote operation interfaces.
